abstract: Niall Booker, the chief executive of HSBC North America, is departing after more than 30 years with the the global financial giant to be replaced by Irene Dorner, Bloomberg News reported. Ms. Dorner previously oversaw the United States operations for Europe's biggest bank. In August, HSBC agreed to sell its U.S. credit card business to Capital One Financial for $2.6 billion.
